Oxnard.Mandalay State Beach:
Mandalay State Beach, also called Mandalay County Park, is a protected beach in the city of Oxnard, California, United States. Managed by Ventura County for the California Department of Parks and Recreation, the park preserves an area of undeveloped sand dunes and wetlands that was once common along the 16.5-mile-long (26.6 km) coastline of the Oxnard Plain.


== History ==
The 92-acre (37 ha) site was established as a California state park in 1985 to preserve public access to the beach while providing for continued protection of the adjacent natural area.
